alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Early; Miller; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Houston, northeastern Jackson, northwestern Gadsden, western Decatur, western Miller, southwestern Early and Seminole Counties through 515 PM EDT/415 PM CDT/... At 440 PM EDT/340 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Donalsonville to 10 miles northwest of Chattahoochee. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Donalsonville, Chattahoochee, Sneads, Grand Ridge, Iron City, Brinson, Jakin, Reynoldsville, Little Hope, Recovery, Mayhaw, Lovedale, Jinks, Dellwood, Riverturn, Sharphagen, Hornsville, Donaldsonville A/P and Buena Vista. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
